content:
üí° Unlocking Company Profits Made Simple!
Ever wondered how a company generates profits? As a stakeholder, employee, client, customer, or curious individual, you don't need specialized knowledge or skills to understand financial reports. All you need is the company's financial report (yearly or quarterly) and some tools like #GoogleAIStudio, #NanoBananaPro and the inspiration from www.voronoi.com as well.
Let's use Volvo Cars' Q3 2025 report as an example. By inputting the data into the AI platform, you can create a visual representation of how Volvo Cars made money in Q3 2025, similar to the provided image of Nvidia.
This era of #AI empowers us to overcome many barriers like Data Visualization, Data Analysis, Frontend Development, UX/UI, and more. Now, when your boss asks about the company's revenue sources and expenses, you have a clear and visually engaging answer.

Resources:
Volvo Cars Q3 2025 Report: 
https://lnkd.in/dsSPzzNf
VoronoiApp: 
https://lnkd.in/dECJEYnT

#GoogleAIStudio #VoronoiApp #Nvidia #NanoBananaPro

Tonight, I successfully renewed my Finansiell ID-Teknik - BankID  using the SEB mobile app in just 25 seconds. I was prompted to do so because my BankID was about to expire in 57 days. However, my wife is facing issues installing BankID on her new #iPhone17 due to a defect in the ICA Banken's app on #iPhoneX. We contacted ICA Banken's call center, and they asked us to wait for an in-app message. Unfortunately, after two weeks waiting, with their instructions, we're still stuck in a loop when trying to sign with BankID for authenticating the installation of new BankID on new iPhone, basically nothing being changed. Following the call center's suggestion, we booked an appointment with SEB tomorrow. We might have to close our ICA Banken account, as they don't seem to care about our issue and advised us to find a bank with a physical office.
Sometimes, businesses overlook customer complaints about their products or services, believing that losing one customer isn't a big deal. However, the negative impact of such experiences goes beyond just one customer, as it spreads through word-of-mouth and online reviews.
With virtual banks like Revolut emerging, the advantages of traditional banks are becoming less obvious. When customers are charged 20 SEK per month and find that their app isn't compatible with new devices, it's only natural for them to switch to other banks. 
This experience serves as a reminder that businesses can't afford to become complacent. Failing to continuously improve products and services will inevitably result in losing customers, as they seek better alternatives. Ultimately, prioritizing customer satisfaction and staying ahead of the competition are key to long-term success.

#ICABanken #BankID #SEB #Revolution #CustomerService

https://lnkd.in/dRMSDU3X

There's an intriguing connection between a person's role in a company, their hairline, and the number of screens on their desk. CEOs, who might sport a receding hairline, often use just one device like an iPhone or iPad or a laptopÔºåwhile developers, known for their diverse hairstyles, usually have multiple screens ‚Äì sometimes more than 3!

The more monitors you have, the higher the risk of hair loss üòâ

True friendship and genuine recognition are priceless and can never be bought. To my wonderful colleagues, friends, and brothers, thank you for your support and the memories we've shared. I will always treasure our experiences together, and there will always be a place in my heart for each of you.

Even when Cloud giant Amazon Web Services (AWS) promises 99.99% uptime, that 0.01% downtime can still significantly impact the public. Sure, Duolingo being temporarily unavailable might not matter to some, but imagine holding Amazon Web Services (AWS) stocks on Robinhood and wanting to sell during a dip at the same time. A grain of sand in one era can grow into a mountain of trouble for a family.Isn‚Äôt it time we asked ourselves: Why place all our eggs in a single cloud provider‚Äôs basket?
When will our private clouds rise to the occasion and come to the rescue?

#AWSDowntime #CloudComputing #Diversify #PrivateClouds #CloudReliability"

There‚Äôs been a lot of buzz around NVIDIA DGX Spark since October 15th, so let‚Äôs talk about two compact #BareMetals that keep coming up in comparison: NVIDIA‚Äôs DGX Spark and Apple‚Äôs Mac mini M4 Pro.
Here are my observations:
üîπ Mac mini M4 Pro
‚Ä¢ 	64GB unified memory
‚Ä¢ 	macOS 26 ‚ÄúTahoe‚Äù
‚Ä¢ 	Seamless integration with Apple‚Äôs ecosystem
‚Ä¢ 	Compact, quiet, and versatile
üîπ NVIDIA DGX Spark
‚Ä¢ 	128GB RAM
‚Ä¢ 	4TB SSD
‚Ä¢ 	~273GB/s memory bandwidth
‚Ä¢ 	Runs a customized Ubuntu 24 Linux OS
Both machines deliver impressive AI performance (roughly comparable to an RTX 3090 Ti in some scenarios). But their focus is different:
‚Ä¢ 	DGX Spark is clearly aimed at professionals running heavy AI/ML workloads. The extra RAM and storage make it a specialized tool for model training and large‚Äëscale experiments.
‚Ä¢ 	Mac mini M4 Pro is an all‚Äërounder. It‚Äôs perfect for those who want a premium desktop that handles everyday tasks effortlessly while still being capable of serious compute work. The Apple ecosystem and macOS polish make it a smooth experience.
üí° So which one makes sense?
‚Ä¢ 	If your priority is intensive AI/ML modeling, DGX Spark is the better fit.
‚Ä¢ 	If you want a versatile, user‚Äëfriendly system that balances performance with everyday usability, the Mac mini M4 Pro is hard to beat.
For me personally, I don‚Äôt see a reason to choose the DGX Spark at this price point. There are more cost‚Äëeffective alternatives out there ‚Äî for example:
üëâ https://lnkd.in/dmrJ-pjp
Don‚Äôt get blinded by the NVIDIA halo effect. Choose what truly fits your needs. If it were up to me, I‚Äôd go with the Mac mini M4 Pro (64GB / 2TB).

Resources:
1. 	https://lnkd.in/d7Ct_CFS
2. 	https://lnkd.in/dUNNav3T

#NVIDIA #DGXSpark #Apple #MacMiniM4Pro #Ubuntu24 #macOS26Tahoe #MachineLearning #AIHardware

Learn to build your own voice-activated AI assistant that can execute tasks like gathering recent AI news from the web, scripting out a podcast, and using tools to put all that into a multi-speaker podcast. See our new short course: "Building Live Voice Agents with Google‚Äôs ADK (Agent Development Kit),‚Äù  taught by Google‚Äôs Lavi Nigam and Sita Lakshmi Sangameswaran. 

ADK provides modular components that make it easy to build and debug agents. It also includes a built-in web interface for tracing agentic reasoning. This course illustrates these concepts via  building a live voice agent that can chain actions to complete a complex task like creating a podcast. This requires maintaining context, implementing guardrails, reasoning, and handling audio streaming, while keeping latency low.

You‚Äôll learn to:
- Build voice agents that listen, reason, and respond
- Guide your agent to follow a specific workflow to accomplish a task
- Coordinate specialized agents to build an agentic podcast workflow that researches topics and produces multi-speaker audio
- Understand how to deploy an agent into production

Even if you‚Äôre not yet building voice systems, you'll find understanding how realtime agents stream data and maintain reliability useful for designing modern agentic applications.

Please join here: https://lnkd.in/ga6tD5rt

I initially thought Revolut was an excellent online bank with a user-friendly iOS app and no fees. However, upon further experience, I discovered that their business practices involve questionable methods, such as using customers' funds without permission to purchase Revolut points.
It's disheartening to see a fintech company that has grown from a startup to a widely used online bank resort to earning profits in this manner. Despite receiving a refund, I will continue to monitor my account closely. If this issue persists, I will update this post and remove all my assets from Revolut, ultimately adding them to my blocked list.

Some updates so far on 14th of Oct. I have got my fully refund from Revolut promptlyÔºåeven earlier than my reply in this post. #Kudos to their customer service for their swift response and commitment to resolving the issue. While my experience wasn't ideal this time, Revolut remains a standout fintech company, offering support for #ApplePay, #GooglePay, #SamsungPay, and more through their visual cards. Most people appreciate the convenience of having a digital wallet on their phones, and Revolut fits the bill, especially for those who don't want to link their main bank accounts directly to Apple or Google Pay.

What's more, their <18 feature allows you to apply and manage a kid's visual card through Revolut App from your own account ‚Äì a game-changer for parents like us without local country‚Äòs citizenship or passports. Despite any shortcomings, Revolut's innovative spirit is commendable, and I wish them continued success in revolutionizing the virtual finance landscape.

#Revolut #BusinessModel #Fintech #WatchYourMoney

All the efforts is not for making others think you are great. But in order to truly repect myself.


‚Äî‚Äî"The Compound Effect" by Darren Hardy

As market followers, we believed our pace was fast enough. However, Tesla continues to rapidly innovate, with their new patent‚Äîautomated assembly of external vehicle parts using a global datum‚Äîset to significantly reduce production costs and boost efficiency. This further highlights Tesla's leading edge. For us as followers, merely increasing speed is not enough; we need genuine innovation, inside and out, to challenge Tesla 's dominance.

ResourceÔºö
1. https://lnkd.in/gUbV5smK
2. https://lnkd.in/gj6zJZU4

#Tesla #PatenNews #EV #Innovation #AutomotiveIndustry #Manufacturing #Competition #Disruption #Leadership

#Tesla "True Unboxed Process 2.0" patent (US 12420879 B1) 
was granted and published today.
We are moving closer and closer to the real-life mass production of Matchbox cars. 

Abstract/Summary: The patent describes a revolutionary departure from traditional linear assembly lines (e.g., Ford's conveyor-belt model). Instead, it uses a modular "unboxed" architecture where vehicle components are built in parallel sub-assembly lines as independent modules (e.g., front, rear, underbody with battery, and sides/roof). These modules are pre-assembled, "decorated" (e.g., painted or finished), and then integrated in a final "mainline" step. This reduces sequential dependencies, enabling:
Parallel processing to cut cycle times.
Reduced factory footprint by up to 40%.
Cost savings of 30-50% per vehicle through fewer parts, less material waste, and automation-friendly designs. The process integrates Tesla's giga-casting (large single-piece castings for underbody) and structural battery packs, allowing seats and wiring to be installed directly on modules before final joining.

If you understand the difference between market leaders and market followers.‚Ä¶..

#BatteryTech #EV #CATL #ElectricalControls #BMS

Bare metal servers are indeed the best practice for many scenarios. However, people often opt for virtualized environments like vSphere, AKS, EKS, or GKE due to the comfort and familiarity these platforms offer. It's important to note, though, that this convenience comes with a higher cost. Cloud service providers such as Azure, AWS, and GCP capitalize on this preference, generating substantial profits from customers who value ease of use and stickiness over bare metal solutions.

#BareMetal #VM #CloudComputing #K8S #AKS #EKS #GKE

It seems that the golden era for companies like Ëê¨‰∫ãÈÅîÂç° , Visa , and American Express to earn easy commission profits might be coming to an end. With increasing choices and opportunities for consumers, the payment industry is undergoing a revolution, driven by innovators like OpenAI & Stripe  or Ë∞∑Ê≠å  & PayPal. As the public experiences smoother payment processes, the dominance of traditional giants from the Web 2.0 era will gradually diminish, paving the way for a new landscape in the future.

Life can be a messÔºå
With doubters coming and going.
Just keep your wins in mind,
You've got a champ's heart inside.

Your scars show your strength,
Wear 'em with pride, it's true.
No matter what life throws your way,
Your spirit's got wings to fly.

Don't ever doubt a champ's heart,
They're strong and tough, you'll see.
They'll face any challenge,
And come out on top, guaranteed.

So trust in those who've earned it,
And learn from what they've done.
A champion's heart can't be beat,
'Cause their courage knows no bounds.

William Karadaghi Alex Kouseras 

#Gokart #ChampionsHeart #NeverSettle #StayStrong #TrustYourInstincts #BelieveInYourself #ResilienceIsKey

There's something truly special about off-road vehicles that capture the hearts of many. Among them, the classic 3-door #Toyota #LandCruiser70 stands tall as an unforgettable icon. Its timeless design and unwavering reliability have earned it a well-deserved reputation as a reliable off-road champion throughout the years.

#Vantage #Toyota #LandCruiser70 #Offroad #ClassicCars

üöÄ MISSION ACCOMPLISHED! 
As promised, here are the results that left the team speechless. Through relentless performance tuning and strategic hardware optimization on our on-premise Dell HPC, our dream team of hardware engineers, DevOps specialists, and system architects just accomplished what many deemed impossible:

üìà The fastest #Android15AOSP clean build time on the #BareMetal we've ever achieved.
Let the numbers do the talking:
Our breakthrough: 7.78 minutes ‚ö°
Previous baseline: 27 minutes (3.5x improvement!)
#Google's official benchmark: ~40 minutes (72 cores + 64GB RAM)
#Azure VM HB120rs_v3 (their best): ~20.18 minutes (AMD EPYC 7V73X, 120 vCPUs, 448GB HBM2, 350GB/s memory bandwidth + Premium NVMe + InfiniBand HDR networking)

We didn't just beat #Azure's flagship HPC instance ‚Äî we CRUSHED it by 259%! üí™ Here's the kicker: Our previous virtualized results with #VMware were trailing behind Azure significantly. Now? We've leapfrogged them entirely through pure engineering excellence.
The secret sauce? Well, like any five-star chef's recipe, that stays in the vaultÔºöÔºâBut here's the gist ‚Äî it's not about throwing expensive hardware at the problem. It's about dissecting every layer of the stack and optimizing with surgical precision.

Why This Matters: #Tesla didn't become the EV leader by just matching competitors ‚Äî they made their cars cooler, smarter, and more advanced. Similarly, we're not just optimizing build times; we're redefining what's possible in our development pipeline and setting up our own private cloud in our #DataCenter as well.
As the Olympic motto says: Citius, Altius, Fortius ‚Äî Faster, Higher, Stronger. There are no shortcuts to peak performance, only dedication to excellence.
Ready to transform your development velocity? The future of high-performance computing isn't in the cloud ‚Äî it's in knowing how to make silicon sing.

P.S. ‚Äî The visualization of #TeslaMCU3 was crafted using advanced prompts +#GeminiNanoBanana. Like our optimization techniques, some secrets are meant to be sensed, not explained. 

#Android15 #DellServer #HPC #AOSP #PerformanceTuning #DevOps  #AndroidAuto #TechInnovation #BuildOptimization #AzureAKS #GCP #HybridCloud #PrivateCloud #TeslaMCU #AMDRyzen

As promised, here are the results that left the team speechless. Through relentless performance tuning and strategic hardware optimization on our on-premise Dell HPC, our dream team of hardware engineers, DevOps specialists, and system architects just accomplished what many deemed impossible:

üìà The fastest #Android15AOSP clean build time on the #BareMetal we've ever achieved.
Let the numbers do the talking:
Our breakthrough: 7.78 minutes ‚ö°
Previous baseline: 27 minutes (3.5x improvement!)
#Google's official benchmark: ~40 minutes (72 cores + 64GB RAM)
#Azure VM HB120rs_v3 (their best): ~20.18 minutes (AMD EPYC 7V73X, 120 vCPUs, 448GB HBM2, 350GB/s memory bandwidth + Premium NVMe + InfiniBand HDR networking)

We didn't just beat #Azure's flagship HPC instance ‚Äî we CRUSHED it by 259%! üí™ Here's the kicker: Our previous virtualized results with #VMware were trailing behind Azure significantly. Now? We've leapfrogged them entirely through pure engineering excellence.
The secret sauce? Well, like any five-star chef's recipe, that stays in the vaultÔºöÔºâBut here's the gist ‚Äî it's not about throwing expensive hardware at the problem. It's about dissecting every layer of the stack and optimizing with surgical precision.

Why This Matters: #Tesla didn't become the EV leader by just matching competitors ‚Äî they made their cars cooler, smarter, and more advanced. Similarly, we're not just optimizing build times; we're redefining what's possible in our development pipeline and setting up our own private cloud in our #DataCenter as well.
As the Olympic motto says: Citius, Altius, Fortius ‚Äî Faster, Higher, Stronger. There are no shortcuts to peak performance, only dedication to excellence.
Ready to transform your development velocity? The future of high-performance computing isn't in the cloud ‚Äî it's in knowing how to make silicon sing.

P.S. ‚Äî The visualization of #TeslaMCU3 was crafted using advanced prompts +#GeminiNanoBanana. Like our optimization techniques, some secrets are meant to be sensed, not explained.

iPad Remote Development - No SSH or Terminal Apps Required

Hej,
Hope you all had a great Christmas. As a New Year's gift to the dev community, I want to share something I've been working on.

Today I successfully connected to my VPS from my iPad Pro Gen 3 and started coding - directly from Safari. No SSH apps, no terminal emulators, just a browser.

Tested over Tele2 cellular 4G connection - proving this works anywhere you have mobile data.

Solving iPad's Development Problem

The main reasons developers avoid iPad for serious work:
- No proper terminal tools
- Limited code IDE support
- Poor SSH connection options
- iOS sandboxing restrictions

This project solves all of these by moving the development environment to a server and accessing it through Safari. Now your iPad becomes a true development machine.

¬†What Works

¬†- Full terminal access in Safari
¬†- Git workflow (commit, push, PR creation)
¬†- File editing with vim/nano
¬†- AI-assisted coding (OpenAI integration)
¬†- Virtual keyboard optimized for touch
¬†- Sessions persist across disconnects
¬†- MFA with Google Authenticator for highest security

Built with Kiro and Claude Code Sonnet 4.5

This entire project was built using Kiro and Claude Code Sonnet 4.5 - proving that AI-assisted development can create real, production-ready tools. Now it enables vibe coding anywhere you have your iPad and internet connection. Coffee shop, airport, wherever - just open Safari and code.

Why This Matters

¬†The iPad Pro has the hardware for serious development work, but iOS limitations have always been the blocker. By running the dev environment on a server and accessing through Safari, we bypass those limitations completely.

You get:
- Full Linux environment
- All your command-line tools
- Your entire workflow, just accessible from anywhere
- No need to carry a laptop
- Secure access with multi-factor authentication

Technical Stack

- WebSocket for real-time communication
- xterm.js for browser terminal
- node-pty for shell management
- TypeScript monorepo
- PWA support
- TOTP-based MFA (Google Authenticator)

Next Steps

I'm developing several deployment scenarios for devs with(out) a VPS:

1. With VPS (what I'm using now)
2. Tailscale VPN (connect iPad to your Mac at home, no VPS needed)
3. Cloudflare Tunnel (permanent setup with custom domain)
4. ngrok (quick testing)
5. GitHub Codespaces (backup option)

For developers without a VPS, options 2-5 mean you can still work remotely with just your Mac at home and your iPad.

Open Source

Will be releasing this for the community soon. Whether you have a VPS, a Mac at home, or just use Codespaces - you'll be able to vibe code from your iPad anywhere you have internet. Forget your MBP and MBA, now in 2026, it is time to work from anywhere with just an iPad.

¬†Interested in trying this? Keep an eye on the updates of this projejct.

#WebDev #iPad #RemoteDev #Opensource #Claudecode #SSH #TCPIP #Terminal

Meet these two ‚ÄúTalk to me‚Äù toys now, and soon you'll be conversing with them in a more advanced way!

New Year, New Project No.2: AI Math Grader
I recently applied for a full‚Äëstack role that requires hands‚Äëon experience with OpenAI, LangChain, Vercel AI SDK, and similar tools. I know the concepts well, but hadn‚Äôt actually built anything with them yet.
At the same time, my daughter has a competitive math entrance exam in a month. We covered about 65% of the material last year‚Ä¶ and we‚Äôve probably forgotten more than that by now : P
So I combined both challenges into one project.
Using Claude Sonnet 4.5 via Google #Antigravity, I built a full AI math‚Äëgrading system in about 3 hours. It takes iPhone photos (HEIC), reads the handwritten exam year, compares her answers against 15 years of past exams (2010‚Äì2025), runs everything through an LLM, and gives instant feedback in Swedish. It even exports a PDF for review.

Tech stack:
LangChain LCEL workflow
Vercel AI SDK streaming
Gemini Pro 2.0 Flash
Provider‚Äëagnostic (OpenAI / Anthropic / Groq)
Next.js 16, TypeScript, Zod
Local RAG built from the exam archives

Now she practices, I snap a photo, and the AI project handles the grading. No more pretending I remember middle‚Äëschool math 100% correctly at 11 PM ‚Äî and I get real hands‚Äëon experience with the exact tools employers keep asking for.
Curious to hear from others:
How do you help your kids prep for exams?
Developers: what real‚Äëworld problems have you solved with your own #RAG setups?
PM if you want to know more about this project, and please feel free to comment, repost, or like if this resonates with your experiences : )


Resource: https://lnkd.in/eeXjhQKb

#AI #LLM #LangChain #Gemini #VercelAI #BuildInPublic #ParentingInTech #RealWorldAI #RAG

Due to the recent extreme snowfall and the challenging road conditions expected tomorrow, considering public transportation for your commute is advisable. If you must drive and your vehicle is a two‚Äëwheel‚Äëdrive automatic model from the last ten years, remember to shift to M and lock it in M2 for better traction compared to D. For older automatic vehicles, look for L2 and use that to drive out of deep snow. And if your car only has D‚Ä¶ well, good luck üòÑ
For manual‚Äëtransmission cars, try starting in 2nd gear when moving out of deep snow. If 1st gear causes too much wheel spin or doesn‚Äôt give you enough controlled power, 2nd gear often provides smoother traction and helps the car move forward more steadily.

When driving out of snow, keep your speed low until the wheels stop slipping, then continue smoothly at a controlled pace. For safer winter driving, preheat your front window and take extra time to thoroughly clear all windows. Maintain a safe distance from other vehicles and use gradual braking instead of sudden stops. These small habits significantly improve visibility and reduce the risk of accidents on slippery roads.

These tips come from 30+ years behind the wheel both in China and Sweden. Put them to the test again today helping a rear-wheel-drive BMW 5 Series and a front-wheel-drive XC60 get unstuck from the snow. Hope this helps someone stay safe out there this winter.

#WinterDriving #SnowSafety #DrivingTips #VehicleControl #DefensiveDriving #SafeCommute #CommunitySupport #SnowFallWeather #Gothenburg #M√∂lndal #Lindholmen

New Year, New Project No.3: Invoice Handeling System
Finally freed my hands from invoice processing hell. Now helping millions of SME owners do the same.
You know that monthly torture? Collecting payment records from Stripe, foodora, UberEat, Wolt... hunting down matching invoices... printing everything... then doing it all over again next month?
I was done with it. So I built an Invoice Handling System that does this automatically.
What it does:

OCR scans and recognizes payments that need invoices
Python connects different platform APIs to fetch correct invoices with proper format and numbers
Prints everything automatically

Why I built this:
My wife runs a restaurant in Sweden. Every month, the same boring invoice work falls on me. I wanted to give this time back‚Äîto all SME owners‚Äîtime to sleep, think about business strategy, maybe even relax.
If this helps some of #SMEs save hours every month on accounting prep, that's real impact.
My principle:
A working solution beats perfect theory. A shabby ‚ÄúOne‚Äùthat solves real problems > a perfect ‚ÄúZero‚Äù that never ships. Just keep building and committing.

#Python #OCR #API #Stripe #Foodora #UberEats #Wolt #Automation #SME #RealProblems

New Year, New Project No.3: Invoice Handling System
Finally freed my hands from invoice processing hell. Now helping millions of SME owners do the same.
You know that monthly torture? Collecting payment records from Stripe , foodora, UberEat, Wolt ‚Ä¶ hunting down matching invoices‚Ä¶ printing everything‚Ä¶ then doing it all over again next month?
I was done with it. So I built an Invoice Handling System that does this automatically.
What it does:
	‚àô	OCR scans and recognizes payments that need invoices
	‚àô	Python connects different platform APIs to fetch correct invoices with proper format and numbers, some of them from our Gmail :)
	‚àô	Fetches everything to our dashboard where users can review and select what to print
Now all payments from Stripe, UberEats, Foodora, Wolt are automated. Next step: SEB API and auth key integration for printing monthly reports and details of Bankgiro payments (more than one at a time).
Why I built this:
My wife runs a restaurant in Sweden. Every month, the same boring invoice work falls on me. I wanted to give this time back‚Äîto all SME owners‚Äîtime to sleep, think about business strategy, maybe even relax.
If this helps some #SMEs save hours every month on accounting prep, that‚Äôs real impact.
My principle:
A working solution beats perfect theory. A shabby ‚ÄúOne‚Äù that solves real problems > a perfect ‚ÄúZero‚Äù that never ships. Just keep building and committing. This is what #FinTech is really about.

#FinTech #Python #OCR #API #Stripe #Foodora #UberEats #Wolt #Automation #SME #RealProblems

Dakar 2026 Stage 9 had that special kind of tension you can feel even through the screen. The gaps between Nani Roma, Cense, and Nassel Al‚ÄëAtyeea were razor‚Äëthin ‚Äî the kind of close fight that reminds you why Dakar is still the toughest race on earth.

This year, there's a significant narrative unfolding: American and European teams are not just participating; they are actively challenging the status quo. Ford Racing and Dacia Sandrider are fully committed to taking on Toyota's long-standing dominance. The momentum is shifting, stage by stage, dune by dune.

A huge respect goes out to all the Dakar legends and every new challenger out there. New Year, New Project No.4: Smart Job Application System 

Saw a lot of people complaining about companies using AI tools to filter candidates. But why are you still manually preparing resumes? Serious question: What's your way to customize a resume for each job? Manually editing in #Word or simply copying into ChatGPT without additional context? How do you guarantee it passes #ATS screening?

I developed a Smart Job Application System using Python, LaTeX, and LLM. The workflow includes:
- Paste job ‚Äî Submit a job URL or full job description into the web app on my #VPS.
- Analyze JD ‚Äî The system parses the posting to extract role, responsibilities, keywords, and required skills.
- Pick LEGO Bricks ‚Äî Modular ‚Äúskills & experience‚Äù blocks are selected that best match the JD.
- AI polish ‚Äî A language model rewrites and tightens each block for clarity, impact, and ATS keyword alignment.
- Generate PDF ‚Äî Produce a clean, professional, ATS‚Äëfriendly LaTeX/PDF resume in minutes.
- Result ‚Äî From ‚Äúnothing in your folder‚Äù to a tailored resume that reads like it was specifically preparied for that job.

#DIY option ‚Äî Prefer hands‚Äëon? Use Overleaf.com with ATS‚Äëfriendly LaTeX templates to reproduce the same output yourself.

But here‚Äôs the bigger truth.
The job market is tough. Brutally tough. And for reasons outside our control, some people may never find a traditional employer. That‚Äôs why building things‚Äîsmall tools, automations, systems‚Äîmatters. It‚Äôs not just about landing a job. It‚Äôs about building leverage.

As Naval says:
- Seek wealth, not money or status.
- Build leverage with code, content, or capital.
- Develop specific knowledge through genuine curiosity.
- Think long‚Äëterm.

This project is just one example of that mindset. Curious? If you want to see whether this system fits your needs, DM me. Happy to walk you through it.

New Year, New Project No.4: Smart Job Application System 

Saw a lot of people complaining about companies using AI tools to filter candidates. But why are you still manually preparing resumes? Serious question: What's your way to customize a resume for each job? Manually editing in #Word or simply copying into ChatGPT without additional context? How do you guarantee it passes #ATS screening?

I developed a Smart Job Application System using Python, LaTeX, and LLM. The workflow includes:
- Paste job ‚Äî Submit a job URL or full job description into the web app on my #VPS.
- Analyze JD ‚Äî The system parses the posting to extract role, responsibilities, keywords, and required skills.
- Pick LEGO Bricks ‚Äî Modular ‚Äúskills & experience‚Äù blocks are selected that best match the JD.
- AI polish ‚Äî A language model rewrites and tightens each block for clarity, impact, and ATS keyword alignment.
- Generate PDF ‚Äî Produce a clean, professional, ATS‚Äëfriendly LaTeX/PDF resume in minutes.
- Result ‚Äî From ‚Äúnothing in your folder‚Äù to a tailored resume that reads like it was specifically preparied for that job.

#DIY option ‚Äî Prefer hands‚Äëon? Use Overleaf.com with ATS‚Äëfriendly LaTeX templates to reproduce the same output yourself.

But here‚Äôs the bigger truth.
The job market is tough. Brutally tough. And for reasons outside our control, some people may never find a traditional employer. That‚Äôs why building things‚Äîsmall tools, automations, systems‚Äîmatters. It‚Äôs not just about landing a job. It‚Äôs about building leverage.

As Naval says:
- Seek wealth, not money or status.
- Build leverage with code, content, or capital.
- Develop specific knowledge through genuine curiosity.
- Think long‚Äëterm.

This project is just one example of that mindset. Curious? If you want to see whether this system fits your needs, DM me. Happy to walk you through it.
And even if the tool isn‚Äôt for you, at least read "The Almanack of Naval Ravikant". It‚Äôs one of the few books that genuinely shifts how you think.

I bet Pencil by TomKrcha will change how you think about #UXUI design. It‚Äôs a fresh, interactive tool that lets you design and edit websites, dashboards, and interfaces in real time ‚Äî either by typing prompts or by manually tweaking elements. Think of it as a live, hands‚Äëon rethink of the design workflow: build something with a prompt, then refine it instantly with direct manipulation.
Why it feels different
Real‚Äëtime iteration ‚Äî no long handoffs between design and prototyping; you see changes as you make them.
Prompt + polish ‚Äî start with natural language, then fine‚Äëtune visually; great for rapid exploration.
Not a Figma clone ‚Äî it‚Äôs an alternative mindset: more interactive, more experimental, more immediate.
Short learning curve, big payoff ‚Äî it takes a minute to get used to, but once you do it speeds up ideation and reduces friction.
Try it
Give www.pencil.dev a spin ‚Äî play with a prompt, tweak the UI, and see how fast you can go from idea to a working interface. If you‚Äôre into fast iteration and new design vibes, this one‚Äôs worth your time. 

Check out Tom Krcha's post on X to learn more about Pencil and its potential to transform UX/UI design: 
Resource: https://lnkd.in/erc_A7XB

Yesterday I went to a Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) meetup about AI in development at Spotify. Great event, lots of energy. But afterwards, I noticed something that's been bothering me.
Almost every Swedish company I talk to: Microsoft stack, VS Code, GitHub Copilot. That's it.
When I ask "why not try Claude, Gemini, or other tools?", the answer is always: "data security concerns."
But here's the thing - most companies already pay for Microsoft and Azure, so they add Copilot for $20/month and feel safe because "Microsoft will protect our data." Is that really security thinking? Or just going with what feels familiar?
Here's What Nobody's Talking About :
Some of the best coding models right now are Chinese: #Qwen-3.5-coder (Alibaba), #GLM-4.7 (Zhipu), #MiniMax 2.1 (Xiyu), #Kimi 2.5 (Moonshot). They're top-ranked on Hugging Face and NVIDIA platforms. In many coding tasks, they're genuinely better than Copilot. Significantly better.
And it's not just Chinese models - Anthropic's Claude, Google's Gemini - nobody's even trying them.
From my experience testing these tools extensively? #Copilot wouldn't even make my top 10. I'm not exaggerating.
My Suggestion :
Look, if you're scared that Chinese AI models will send your data back to China(Maybe not) - fine, I understand that concern. But at least try other American AI giants like #Anthropic's #ClaudeCode, #GoogleGemini & #Antigravity, #AWS #Kiro, or even #OpenAI's #Codex directly instead of staying trapped within Copilot.
Unless you have factory software locked into Microsoft, why not explore what's actually best for your team?
Most of these models are easy to access: Ollama (local) or on cloud, OpenAI-compatible APIs, NVIDIA catalog, many with free tiers. Take your actual code, run tests, compare. Then decide based on performance, not on "this is what other Swedish companies use."
A Personal Note
I'm from China, working in tech here in Sweden. I love it here. But sometimes there's this automatic assumption: Chinese technology = risky, American technology = safe. That's not how technology works.
Funny timing though - with all the #Greenland drama lately, suddenly Chinese companies seem a bit more "acceptable" in Europe :) 
Maybe it takes geopolitical chaos to remind us that technological diversity isn't just nice to have - it's strategic.
What worries me: what if the US restricts AI services due to geopolitics one day? Shouldn't we at least know what alternatives exist?
The "Can't Live Without AI" theme from yesterday's meetup is true. AI is part of our work now.
But let's make sure we're choosing the right tools, not just the comfortable ones.
Maybe I'm overthinking this. Maybe I'm too sensitive about the China thing. But I genuinely think we're missing out on better tools because of assumptions we haven't questioned. What do you think? Read the article for more details.
